metadata.title: CVE-2022-0494 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A kernel information leak flaw was identified in the scsi_ioctl function indrivers/scsi/scsi_ioctl.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a localattacker with a special user privilege (CAP_SYS_ADMIN or CAP_SYS_RAWIO) tocreate issues with confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-dell300x - 4.15.0-1051.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1080-gke - 5.4.0-1080.86~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-gkeop - 5.4.0-1051.54~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1117-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1117.125
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1135-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1135.145
No subscription required
